bibl.title: Territory of Washington V. Wilson D. Coyle. Type of document

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: Before W. F. Hooker Justice of the Peace Cheney precinct

T.D. Boggs of said county and Territory being duly sworn on this oath says that in Spokane County Washington Territory on the 14th day of April A.D. 1885 the said defendant W.D. Coyle unlawfully and feloniously upon one Charles Seaman then and there being did make an assault and with a certain deadly weapon that is to say an called steel knuckles in his right hand then and there being and held, did feloniously & unlawfully assault, beat and wound with intent then and there on the part of him the said W.D. Coyle to inflict upon the person of the said Charles Seaman a bodily injury, no considerable provocation appearing for said assault and the circumstances of the said assault showing then and there on the part of him the said W.D. Coyle a wilful, malignant and abandoned heart. T.D. Boggs
The foregoing complaint duly sworn to and subscribed before me this 14th day of April A.D. 1885 W.F. Hooker Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington vs. W.D. Coyle
Complaint Filed by me in my office April 14th 1885
